alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Gloucester; Salem (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 2:30AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cumberland, southeastern Salem and southeastern Gloucester Counties through 300 AM EDT... At 230 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Shiloh, or near Bridgeton, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Vineland, Millville, Bridgeton, Glassboro, Pitman, Clayton, Alloway, Newfield, Elmer, Shiloh, Franklinville, Olivet, Malaga, Fairton, Seabrook Farms, Rosenhayn and Centerton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
